com.salesforce.omakase.writer

Interface Writable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AtRuleBlock, AtRuleExpression, AtRuleMember, FunctionValue, Groupable<P,T>, PropertyValueMember, Refinable, SelectorPart, SimpleSelector, Statement, StatementIterable, Syntax, Term
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAtRuleMember, AbstractGroupable, AbstractSelectorPart, AbstractSyntax, AbstractTerm, AtRule, AttributeMatchType, AttributeSelector, ClassSelector, Combinator, Comment, Conditional, ConditionalAtRuleBlock, Declaration, FontDescriptor, FontFaceBlock, GenericAtRuleBlock, GenericAtRuleExpression, GenericFunctionValue, HexColorValue, IdSelector, KeyframeSelector, KeywordValue, LinearGradientFunctionValue, MediaQuery, MediaQueryExpression, MediaQueryList, MediaRestriction, MetadataExpression, NumericalValue, Operator, OperatorType, PropertyName, PropertyValue, PseudoClassSelector, PseudoElementSelector, RawFunction, RawSyntax, Rule, Selector, StringValue, Stylesheet, TypeSelector, UnicodeRangeValue, UniversalSelector, UnquotedIEFilter, UrlFunctionValue

    public interface Writable
    Indicates that something can be written to a StyleAppendable.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isWritable()
      Returns whether this unit should actually be written.
      void write(StyleWriter writer, StyleAppendable appendable)
      Outputs this Writable's string representation.

    • Method Detail

      • isWritable

        boolean isWritable()
        Returns whether this unit should actually be written.

        Usually this should just return true, however some units that are detachable or otherwise potentially invalid should first check their state and respond appropriately.

        Returns:
        True if the unit should be written.

      • write

        void write(StyleWriter writer,
           StyleAppendable appendable)
    throws IOException
        Outputs this Writable's string representation.

        Important notes for implementation:

        Do not use the StyleWriter in an attempt to write direct content (Strings, chars, etc...). Use the StyleAppendable.

        The StyleWriter should be used to make decisions based on writer settings (e.g., compressed vs. verbose output mode), as well as for writing inner or child Writables. Do not call the this method method directly on inner or child Writables! That would bypass any overrides that are set on the StyleWriter. Use StyleWriter.writeInner(Writable, StyleAppendable) instead.

        Parameters:
        writer - Writer to use for output settings and for writing inner Writables.
        appendable - Append direct content to this StyleAppendable.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
